Invest.definition: to install in an office or position 2 a
Invest.origin: [Medieval Latin investire , from Latin, to clothe, from in- in + vestis garment]

1.definition: to commit (money) in order to earn a financial return

2 a.definition: to furnish with or formally grant power or authority

sub_terms.b: to grant someone control or authority overvb  [Italianto clothe, invest money, from Latin, to clothe]

2 a.investire: to clothe, invest money, from Latin, to clothe]

2.definition: to make use of for future benefits or advantagesto commit funds or purchase something of intrinsic value for future gainmake an investment often used with[in precious metals]
